p: The predictions generated using MEAN ENSEMBLE, MMM ENSEMBLE, and Maxent all showed that potential distribution of Rhodiola varies among species and groups under four climate scenarios: LIG, LGM, current and future (2050 RCP8.5) (Table 2; Fig. 3; Supplementary Figs S2– S4). MEAN ENSEMBLE and MMM ENSEMBLE predicted similar patterns of range shifting (Supplementary Tables S7, S8), which both appear to give more conservative predictions than Maxent. For example, Maxent, on average, predicted relatively larger range shifts and showed some differences in tendency for range shifting to occur (e.g. from current to 2050 for R. henryi; see Table 2).
